channel.title: I guess this can be considered my first NPC
channel.description:
[img]http://a.imageshack.us/img687/6922/eyeic.jpg[/img]
Eh, its still pretty basic and doesn't have much effort put into it at all, but I'm understanding Blender a lot more now. I just can't figure out how to add materials to different parts of the mesh, even following the tutorials I'm finding :/ Could anyone help with that please? :P
But aside from that, C/C, I still desperately need it :P
EDIT: Colored [img]http://a.imageshack.us/img827/2686/eyecolored.jpg[/img]

item.title: I guess this can be considered my first NPC
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“dylan_0789, post:7, topic:353480”]Select the faces, and in F9 click “New” then Assign and change the material color.[/quote]I’ve done that and it doesn’t work. I’m not sure if I’m doing something wrong or not, but it all stays whatever material I set in F6 or whatever it is.

Read full topic
item.source: I guess this can be considered my first NPC

item.title: I guess this can be considered my first NPC
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

Select the faces, and in F9 click “New” then Assign and change the material color.

Read full topic
item.source: I guess this can be considered my first NPC

item.title: I guess this can be considered my first NPC
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“0bbyme, post:4, topic:353480”]haha ok, well in order to make multiple materials on a single object you have to select the faces you want and then go into editing (f9) and then you will see under links and materials a new button press it until you have 2 different materials and then go to the second and press the assign button. then go into materials and change it to a different color.
this is all dune while in edit mode (tab)[/quote]I have done that already and have different areas assigned to different materials, but they just won’t change

Read full topic
item.source: I guess this can be considered my first NPC

item.title: I guess this can be considered my first NPC
item.dc:creator: @0bbyme 0bbyme
item.description:
@0bbyme wrote:

haha ok, well in order to make multiple materials on a single object you have to select the faces you want and then go into editing (f9) and then you will see under links and materials a new button press it until you have 2 different materials and then go to the second and press the assign button. then go into materials and change it to a different color.
this is all dune while in edit mode (tab)

Read full topic
